alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 4:43PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado through 545 PM MDT... At 443 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles west of Kit Carson, or 33 miles west of Cheyenne Wells, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado, including the following locations... Wild Horse. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for east central Colorado.
